subtitleNullable: Injuries, Reproductive Health, Financial Protection, and More
descriptionNullable:
_____
# WHO Health Indicators for India
### Injuries, Reproductive Health, Financial Protection, and More
By Humanitarian Data Exchange [[source]](https://data.world/humdata)
_____

### About this dataset
> This dataset from the World Health Organization's data portal contains comprehensive indicators covering mortality and global health estimates, Sustainable Development Goals, Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), health systems, malaria, tuberculosis, child health, infectious diseases, World Health Statistics, Health Financing, Public Health and Environment and more. This data covers a range of topics critical to improving public health including substance use & mental health; injuries and violence; HIV/AIDS & other STIs; nutrition; urban health; noncommunicable diseases NCDs); insecticide resistance; oral hygiene; UHC- Universal Health Coverage Observatories for eHealth (GOe); RSUD Governance Policy & Financing - Prevention Treatment Capacity & Treatment Coverage Pharmacological treatment Screening & Brief Interventions prevention Programs& Providers Special Programmes/Services Human Resources Information Systems Youth Financial Protection AMR Glass Non-Communicable Diseases & Mental Health as well as Health Work Force Neglected Tropical Diseases AMR GASP ICD Sexual and Reproductive Healthcare. Resource description links are included in the dataset.  With hundreds of uniquely rich indicators this essential set of statistics from India provides necessary information to monitor healthcare delivery quality access inequality impact disease burden risk factors practices technology behaviour prevalence morbidity mortality policies responses initiatives research evaluation changes over time trends demography and much more. For creating evidence based interventions for improved public health outcomes leverage this creative commons licensed resource today!

### More Datasets
> For more datasets, click [here](https://www.kaggle.com/thedevastator/datasets).

### Featured Notebooks
> - 🚨 **Your notebook can be here!** 🚨! 

### How to use the dataset
> This dataset contains health indicators from the World Health Organization's data portal. It can be used to explore a range of topics related to health in India, including mortality and global health estimates, sustainable development goals, Millennium Development Goals (MDGs), and more. 
> 
> To get started with this dataset, first take some time to read through the columns and familiarize yourself with the data that is available. The columns include information such as GHO code (Global Health Observatory code for the indicator), publish state, year of measurement and codes for region and country. 
> 
> Once you have a better understanding of what is provided in each column, then you can begin looking at trends over time or comparing various metrics across regions or countries. For example, you could compare mortality rates between different states or compare poverty rates over years within one state or region. You could also use this data to analyze progress made on particular healthcare initiatives over times by examining metrics like infant mortality rate or HIV/AIDS prevalence rates. 
> 
> It is also important to take notice of any disclaimers or caveats that come with using this dataset before beginning your analysis. Additionally keep an eye out for how recent the data is as it may not always reflect up-to-date statistics on current trends due to its limited scope depending on when it was gathered by WHO last updated its database - which should always be included in any discussion regarding findings based off this dataset's results

### Research Ideas
> - Comparing the health outcomes of different regions in India and making informed policy decisions based on these insights. 
> - Monitoring changes in indicators to measure progress towards global health goals and track improvements in public health care across the country. 
> - Creating visualizations and dashboards to display information about key health indicators, such as Healthcare Expenditure, Infant Mortality Rate, or Health Coverage Indicators like Out-of-Pocket Expenditure for healthcare services

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> [Data Source](https://data.world/humdata)
> 
>


### License
> 
> 
> See the dataset description for more information.

### Columns

**File: health-financing-indicators-for-india-45.csv**
| Column name                        | Description                                                |
|:-----------------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**                     | Global Health Observatory code for the indicator. (String) |
| **GHO (DISPLAY)**                  | Display name of the indicator. (String)                    |
| **GHO (URL)**                      | URL link to the indicator page. (URL)                      |
| **DATASOURCE (CODE)**              | Code for the data source. (String)                         |
| **DATASOURCE (DISPLAY)**           | Display name of the data source. (String)                  |
| **DATASOURCE (URL)**               | URL link to the data source page. (URL)                    |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (CODE)**            | Code for the publish state. (String)                       |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (DISPLAY)**         | Display name of the publish state. (String)                |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (URL)**             | URL link to the publish state page. (URL)                  |
| **YEAR (CODE)**                    | Code for the year. (String)                                |
| **YEAR (DISPLAY)**                 | Display name of the year. (String)                         |
| **YEAR (URL)**                     | URL link to the year page. (URL)                           |
| **REGION (CODE)**                  | Code for the region. (String)                              |
| **STARTYEAR**                      | Start year of the indicator. (Integer)                     |
| **ENDYEAR**                        | End year of the indicator. (Integer)                       |
| **REGION (DISPLAY)**               | Display name of the region. (String)                       |
| **REGION (URL)**                   | URL link to the region page. (URL)                         |
| **WORLDBANKINCOMEGROUP (CODE)**    | Code for the World Bank income group. (String)             |
| **WORLDBANKINCOMEGROUP (DISPLAY)** | Display name of the World Bank income group. (String)      |
| **WORLDBANKINCOMEGROUP (URL)**     | URL link to the World Bank income group page. (URL)        |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)**                 | Code for the country. (String)                             |
| **COUNTRY (DISPLAY)**              | Display name of the country. (String)                      |
| **COUNTRY (URL)**                  | URL link to the country page. (URL)                        |
| **Display Value**                  | Display value of the indicator. (String)                   |
| **Numeric**                        | Numeric value of the indicator. (Float                     |

_____

**File: universal-health-coverage-indicators-for-india-4.csv**
| Column name                | Description                                                |
|:---------------------------|:-----------------------------------------------------------|
| **GHO (CODE)**             | Global Health Observatory code for the indicator. (String) |
| **GHO (DISPLAY)**          | Display name of the indicator. (String)                    |
| **GHO (URL)**              | URL link to the indicator page. (URL)                      |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (CODE)**    | Code for the publish state. (String)                       |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (DISPLAY)** | Display name of the publish state. (String)                |
| **PUBLISHSTATE (URL)**     | URL link to the publish state page. (URL)                  |
| **YEAR (CODE)**            | Code for the year. (String)                                |
| **YEAR (DISPLAY)**         | Display name of the year. (String)                         |
| **YEAR (URL)**             | URL link to the year page. (URL)                           |
| **REGION (CODE)**          | Code for the region. (String)                              |
| **REGION (DISPLAY)**       | Display name of the region. (String)                       |
| **REGION (URL)**           | URL link to the region page. (URL)                         |
| **COUNTRY (CODE)**         | Code for the country. (String)                             |
| **STARTYEAR**              | Start year of the indicator. (Integer)                     |
| **ENDYEAR**                | End year of the indicator. (Integer)                       |
| **COUNTRY (DISPLAY)**      | Display name of the country. (String)                      |
| **COUNTRY (URL)**          | URL link to the country page. (URL)                        |
| **Display Value**          | Display value of the indicator. (String)                   |
| **Numeric**                | Numeric value of the indicator. (Float                     |
| **Low**                    | Lower bound of the indicator. (Float)                      |
| **High**                   | Upper bound of the indicator. (Float)                      |
| **StdErr**                 | Standard error of the indicator. (Float)                   |
| **StdDev**                 | Standard deviation of the indicator. (Float)               |
| **Comments**               | Comments associated with the indicator. (String)           |

### Acknowledgements
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit the original authors.
> If you use this dataset in your research, please credit [Humanitarian Data Exchange](https://data.world/humdata).
